title: Review & setlist: Lorde’s stripped down, anti-pop show wows TD Garden
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Concert Reviews “We always have the best time here.

title: Suya Joint manager released after months in ICE custody
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food News “His release is more than one family’s relief — it is a reminder that justice is possible when we stand together.
" Owner Cecelia Lizotte and her brother Paul Dama and his attorney Abeba Attles talk with state Sen.
Liz Miranda outside Suya Joint in Boston on September 26, 2025.

title: Talking Bob Dylan with historian Douglas Brinkley
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Local News The author/Dylan interviewer/CNN commentator will discuss Dylan and Joan Baez at Boston’s Folk Americana Hall of Fame event Sept.
Joan Baez and Bob Dylan, pictured here performing at the Newport Folk Festival in 1964, will both be discussion topics at Saturday's symposium.

title: Can Marcelo Mayer return to Red Sox during playoffs?  Alex Cora says ‘he’s pushing’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox Mayer underwent wrist surgery in August.
Marcelo Mayer has been out since July with a wrist injury.

(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Roche September 27, 2025 | 11:08 AM 2 minutes to read The Red Sox are in the playoffs, and if they play deep enough into October, they might get some reinforcements.

title: Mass. man whose dog died in fireworks explosion to face charges
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News Kevin Ruiz, 54, of Dartmouth, will face multiple charges after a dog died in a house explosion on Sept.
A Dartmouth man is facing charges after a dog was killed in a house explosion and fire believed to be caused by fireworks.

title: 2 separate kitten incidents prompt warning for drivers to check under the hood
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News The baby kittens, named Sparky and Pisces, were recently found seeking warmth under the hoods of cars located in Taunton and Brockton.
A 5-month-old male kitten, named Pisces, was found in a car engine in Brockton.

title: Mass. health officials announce additional human cases of West Nile virus
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News The risk of West Nile virus is now high in 47 communities across Suffolk, Middlesex, Essex, and Worcester counties.
Mosquitoes are trapped and tested for viruses, included West Nile Virus.

title: How eggplant and peach sculptures are starting controversy
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Love Letters An artist's suggestive sculptures are causing debate in Ellicott City, Maryland, and are raising questions about permits.
Late day sun hits the peach orchards at White Gate Farm in Dracut, MA on September 03, 2021.

title: Here’s what Alex Cora, Craig Breslow said after Red Sox playoff-clinching win
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Boston Red Sox “Because at every challenge, they’ve shown that resilience and the ability to overcome it.
” Alex Cora popped champagne with his team after Friday night's thrilling win to cement a spot for the Red Sox in the upcoming playoffs.

title: Red Sox clinch playoff berth for first time since 2021 via Ceddanne Rafaela walk-off hit
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Boston Red Sox “I’m finishing it.
